verses.verse: God’s Steadfast Love Endures (Job 19.21; Jer 15.17, 18) I am one who has seen affliction under the rod of God’s (Heb his) wrath;
he has driven and brought me into darkness without any light;
(Isa 5.25) against me alone he turns his hand, again and again, all day long.
(Job 16.8; Ps 51.8; Isa 38.13; Jer 50.17) He has made my flesh and my skin waste away; he has broken my bones;
he has besieged and enveloped me with bitterness and tribulation;
(Ps 88.5, 6) he has made me sit in darkness like the dead of long ago.
(Job 3.23; Jer 40.4) He has walled me about so that I cannot escape; he has put heavy chains on me;
(Job 30.20; Ps 22.2) though I call and cry for help, he shuts out my prayer;
he has blocked my ways with hewn stones; he has made my paths crooked.
(Job 10.16; Isa 38.13) He is a bear lying in wait for me, a lion in hiding;
he led me off my way and tore me to pieces; he has made me desolate;
(Job 7.20; Ps 7.12, 13) he bent his bow and set me as a mark for his arrow.
He shot into my vitals the arrows of his quiver;
(Job 30.9; Jer 20.7) I have become the laughingstock of all my people, the object of their taunt songs all day long.
He has filled me with bitterness; he has sated me with wormwood.
He has made my teeth grind on gravel; he has made me cower in ashes;
my soul is bereft of peace; I have forgotten what happiness is;
so I say, “Gone is my glory and all that I had hoped for from the LORD.”
(Jer 9.15) The thought of my affliction and my homelessness is wormwood and gall!
(Ps 42.5, 6, 11) My soul continually thinks of it and is bowed down within me.
But this I call to mind, and therefore I have hope:
(Mal 3.6) The steadfast love of the LORD never ceases, (Syr Tg: Heb LORD, we are not cut off) his mercies never come to an end;
(Zeph 3.5) they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
(Ps 16.5; 33.18) “The LORD is my portion,” says my soul, “therefore I will hope in him.”
(Isa 25.9; 26.9; 30.18) The LORD is good to those who wait for him, to the soul that seeks him.
(Ps 37.7; 40.1; Isa 30.15) It is good that one should wait quietly for the salvation of the LORD.
(Ps 94.12) It is good for one to bear the yoke in youth,
(Jer 15.17) to sit alone in silence when the Lord (Heb he) has imposed it,
to put one’s mouth to the dust (there may yet be hope),
(Isa 50.6; Mt 5.39) to give one’s cheek to the smiter and be filled with insults.
(Ps 94.14) For the Lord will not reject forever.
(Ps 78.38; Hos 11.8) Although he causes grief, he will have compassion according to the abundance of his steadfast love;
(Ezek 33.11; Heb 12.10) for he does not willingly afflict or grieve anyone.
When all the prisoners of the land are crushed under foot,
(Ps 140.12) when justice is perverted in the presence of the Most High,
(Hab 1.13) when one’s case is subverted— does the Lord not see it?
(Ps 33.9) Who can command and have it done, if the Lord has not ordained it?
(Job 2.10; Isa 45.7) Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that evil and good come?
(Mic 7.9; Heb 12.5, 6) Why should any who draw breath complain about the punishment of their sins?
(Ps 119.59; 2 Cor 13.5) Let us test and examine our ways and return to the LORD.
(Ps 25.1; 28.2) Let us lift up our hearts as well as our hands to God in heaven.
(Jer 5.7, 9; Dan 9.5) We have transgressed and rebelled, and you have not forgiven.
(Ps 83.15; Lam 2.21) You have wrapped yourself with anger and pursued us, killing without pity;
you have wrapped yourself with a cloud so that no prayer can pass through.
(1 Cor 4.13) You have made us filth and rubbish among the peoples.
(Lam 2.16) All our enemies have opened their mouths against us;
(Isa 24.17; Jer 48.43) panic and pitfall have come upon us, devastation and destruction.
My eyes flow with rivers of tears because of the destruction of my people. (Heb the daughter of my people)
(Ps 77.2) My eyes will flow without ceasing, without respite,
(Isa 63.15) until the LORD from heaven looks down and sees.
My eyes cause me grief at the fate of all the young women in my city.
(Ps 35.7) Those who were my enemies without cause have hunted me like a bird;
(Jer 37.16) they flung me alive into a pit and hurled stones on me;
(Ps 69.2; Isa 38.10) water closed over my head; I said, “I am lost.”
(Jon 2.2) I called on your name, O LORD, from the depths of the pit;
(Ps 116.1, 2) you heard my plea, “Do not close your ear to my cry for help, but give me relief!”
(Ps 145.18; Isa 41.10, 14) You came near when I called on you; you said, “Do not fear!”
(Ps 71.23; Jer 51.36) You have taken up my cause, O Lord; you have redeemed my life.
You have seen the wrong done to me, O LORD; judge my cause.
(Jer 11.19, 20; 18.18) You have seen all their malice, all their plots against me.
You have heard their taunts, O LORD, all their plots against me.
The whispers and murmurs of my assailants are against me all day long.
Whether they sit or rise—see, I am the object of their taunt songs.
Pay them back for their deeds, O LORD, according to the work of their hands!
Give them anguish of heart; your curse be on them!
(Ps 8.3) Pursue them in anger and destroy them from under the LORD’s heavens.
